suprascando: <entryFree id="n47009" type="hapax" key="su^prascando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭpra-scando</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n47009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to climb over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surmount</hi>: haec cum fines suprascandit, Liv 1, 32, 8.</sense></entryFree>
suprasedeo: <entryFree id="n47010" type="main" key="supra_se^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suprā-sĕdĕo</orth>, <sense id="n47010.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, III.</sense></entryFree>
supremitas: <entryFree id="n47011" type="main" key="su^pre_mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭprēmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>supremus</etym>, <sense id="n47011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the highest extreme</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n47011.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The last of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepultura, qui supremitatis ho nor est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 13, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47011.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The highest honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremitates et praeeminentias adire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
supremo: <entryFree id="n47012" type="main" key="su^pre_mo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭprēmō</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sŭprēmum</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭprē-mus</orth>, v. superus.</entryFree>
sura: <entryFree id="n47013" type="main" key="su_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the calf of the leg.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47013.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 120</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=256" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 256</bibl> (501); 399 (646); Turp. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 236, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:623" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 623</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:14" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teretes, Hor C. 2, 4, 21: tumentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:Epod. 8:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 8, 10</bibl></cit>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 13, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 342</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Puniceo suras evincta cothurno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 337</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 6, 89, 18</bibl> Burm.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 338</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47013.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in anatomy, <hi rend="ital">the smaller bone of the leg</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 11, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47014" type="main" key="Sura2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Germany</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Saur</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 355</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47015" type="main" key="Sura3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surae: <entryFree id="n47016" type="main" key="Surae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Surae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surclo: <entryFree id="n47017" type="main" key="surclo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surclo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. surculo, II.</entryFree>
surculaceus: <entryFree id="n47018" type="hapax" key="surcu^la_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>surculus</etym>, <sense id="n47018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durities seminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 7, 36, § 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surcularis: <entryFree id="n47019" type="main" key="surcu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">producing young shoots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprouts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surcularius: <entryFree id="n47020" type="main" key="surcu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to shoots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twigs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans><tr>planted with young trees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: cicada, <hi rend="ital">living among the twigs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branches</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surculo: <entryFree id="n47021" type="main" key="surcu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n47021.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To clear of shoots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sprouts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surculate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47021.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind together with twigs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:5:section=183" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 5, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:2:section=261 al" default="NO">7, 2, § 261 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
surculose: <entryFree id="n47022" type="main" key="surcu^lo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. surculosus <sense id="n47022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
surculosus: <entryFree id="n47023" type="main" key="surcu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>surculus</etym>, <sense id="n47023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 31, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 15, 87, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-cŭlōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">like wood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arescit herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surculus: <entryFree id="n47024" type="main" key="surcu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young twig</hi> or <hi rend="ital">branch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shoot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprig</hi> (syn. malleolus). </sense><sense id="n47024.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 10, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculum defringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:28:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 28, 110</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47024.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sucker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> of a plant for growth: <cit><quote lang="la">da mihi ex istā arbore quos seram surculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:41:2" default="NO">1, 41, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 13, § 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47024.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:4" default="NO">7, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:10" default="NO">7, 12, 10</bibl>; 9, 4, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 350, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus surculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surdaones: <entryFree id="n47025" type="main" key="Surdaones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Surdaones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Spain.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surdaster: <entryFree id="n47026" type="hapax" key="surdaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdaster</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <sense id="n47026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [surdus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat deaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hard of hearing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl>; cf. Prisc. pp. 618 and 628 P.</sense></entryFree>
surde: <entryFree id="n47027" type="main" key="surde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. surdus <sense id="n47027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
surdesco: <entryFree id="n47028" type="hapax" key="surdesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [surdus], <hi rend="ital">to become deaf</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 157:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 157, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surdigo: <entryFree id="n47029" type="main" key="surdi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deafness</hi> (post class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 9 al.</bibl> <pb n="1817" /> <cb n="SURG" /></sense></entryFree>
surditas: <entryFree id="n47030" type="main" key="surdi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>surdus</etym>, <sense id="n47030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deafness</hi> (rare but ciass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
surditia: <entryFree id="n47031" type="main" key="surdi^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deafness</hi> (late Lat.), Gargil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Pon. 25, p. 424" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Pon. 25, p. 424</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
surdus: <entryFree id="n47032" type="main" key="surdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. svar, heavy; svaras, weight; cf. O. H. Germ. swārida, weight</etym>, <sense id="n47032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deaf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47032.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne mi ut surdo verbera auris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 204</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si surdus sit, varietates vocum noscere possit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam aut hic surdus aut haec muta facta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stone-deaf</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 926</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 39" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 39</bibl>.—Prov.: surdo narrare, canere, etc., <hi rend="ital">preach to deaf ears</hi>, <hi rend="ital">talk to the wind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nae ille haud scit, quam mihi nunc surdo narret fabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantabant surdo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 47; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non canimus surdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 8</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (praecepta) vereor, ne vana surdis auribus cecinerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:70:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 70, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrare asello Fabellam surdo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 200</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suadere surdis, quid sit opus facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1050" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1050</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47032.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47032.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Deaf</hi> to any thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not listening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unwilling to hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inattentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regardless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensible</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inexorable;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">not understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not apprehending</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orando surdas jam aures reddideras mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 89</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 32, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 16</bibl> (3, 8), 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 20</bibl> (3, 13), 13: <cit><quote lang="la">non surdus judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11, 25</bibl></cit> (7, 15): <cit><quote lang="la">ad mea munera surdus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per numquam surdos in tua vota deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdae ad omnia solacia aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdae ad fortia consilia Vitellio aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 67 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdus adversus aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 50:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 50, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdus sum,</quote> <trans><tr>I will not hear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdas clamare ad undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 6.—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to which the gods are deaf</tr>, <tr>to which they will not hearken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdaeque adhibent solatia menti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas lacrimas litora surda bibent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">leges rem surdam, inexorabilem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surda tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>not susceptible of cultivation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdus timori,</quote> <trans><tr>not capable of fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:40:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 40, 116</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scopulis surdior Icari Voces audit adhuc integer (i. e. castus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdior illa freto surgente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdior aequoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:804" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 804</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non saxa surdiora navitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:54" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47032.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars genitor, votorum haud surde meorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:554" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pactorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:692" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 692</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47032.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things that give out a dull, indistinct sound, <hi rend="ital">dull-sounding</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=58" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 58</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 576" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdum quiddam et barbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47032.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is not heard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dumb</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 5, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">buccina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:19" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non erit officii gratia surda tui,</quote> <trans><tr>unsung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:6:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:75" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surdum et ignobile opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:359" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen parentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:248" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos diri conscia facti mens surdo verbere caedit,</quote> <trans><tr>secret</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47032.7" n="D" level="2"> Of odor, appearance, meaning, etc., <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indistinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirant cinnama surdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:36" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebes unitate surdā color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrimen figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 15, 30, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res surdae ac sensu carentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 1; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:146" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 13, 120, § 146</bibl>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">surdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faintly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperfectly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indistinctly</hi>: surde audire, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 194</bibl> P. (Com. Fragm. v. 348 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
surena: <entryFree id="n47033" type="main" key="sure_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=77" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 77</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47034" type="main" key="sure_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, among the Parthians, the name of the highest dignitary in the State next to that of the king, <sense id="n47034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the grand vizier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surgo: <entryFree id="n47035" type="main" key="surgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surgo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">surrĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>): surrexi and subrexi, surrectum and subrectum, 3 (<sense id="n47035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> surregit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=296" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 296</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">orig. forms: surrigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 4</bibl>: surriguntur, id. Ira, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: surrigebant, Hier. Vit. Hil. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subrigens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>: subrigere,<cb n="SURG" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 89, § 365</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Sync. forms: surrexti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:79:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 79, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrexe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 73</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from surrigo, from sub-rego</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47035.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevate</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">after the Aug. per., the original uncontracted forms were chiefly used in this sense, to distinguish it from the class. signif., II.): plaudite, valete: lumbos surgite atque extollite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 329" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes capitum hiatus ( = capita hiantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgit caput Apenninus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot surrigit aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae motus defert montes, surrigit plana, valles extuberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim subrigens se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cristam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: horrent et surriguntur capilli,</quote> <trans><tr>rise</tr>, <tr>stand erect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae surrectā cuspide in terrā fixae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucrone surrecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcar equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad M. Caes. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad M. Caes. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures subrectae furentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres subrectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrecta moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:599" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 599</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47035.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand up</hi> (the predominant and class. signif. of the word; syn.: exsurgo, exorior). </sense><sense id="n47035.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47035.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">a mensā surgunt saturi, poti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a cenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e lectulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sellā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:65:section=147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 65, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex subselliis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:771" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 771</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:735" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 735</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:579" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab umbris ad lumina vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:771" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 771</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., of an orator: cur, cum tot summi oratores sedeant, ego potissimum surrexerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:78:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 78, 316</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad respondendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 18, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgit ad hos Ajax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo eum, qui dicturus est, sollicitum surgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundā vigiliā surgit,</quote> <trans><tr>breaks up the camp</tr>, <tr>marches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47035.5" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. ascendo): surgat pius ignis ab arā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit subsidere valles ... lapidosos surgere montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons Rhipaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the sea: fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:508" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoeni fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina oleae in altum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistula disparibus avenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 192</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgens in cornua cervus ( = ferens cornua ardua),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>towering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri surgunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux Praecipitatur aquis et aquis nox surgit ab isdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:629" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 629</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 822" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 822</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 777</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (aedes) proxima surgit ovili,</quote> <trans><tr>stands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:529" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 529</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47035.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47035.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">get up</hi> from bed, from sleep: <cit><quote lang="la">ille multo ante lucem surrexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, a: <cit><quote lang="la">cum die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mane ad invisas rotas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad lites novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:13:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praescripta munia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47035.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To rise</hi> in growth, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow up; to rise</hi> in building, <hi rend="ital">be built</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">venerata Ceres culmo surgeret alto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potuere surgere messes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sementis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgens arx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 366</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc aggere multo Surgit opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 679</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area cinere mixtisque pumicibus oppleta surrexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascanius surgens,</quote> <trans><tr>growing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 274</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47035.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To ascend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad auras Aetherias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:762" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 762</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47035.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">multum supra prosam orationem surgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:81" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nunc animo sententia surgit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna aspera surgit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:228" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium suis velocius annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ulla laborum nova mi facies surgit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 104</bibl></cit>.—Of the swell of a verse: sex mihi surgat opus numeris; <cit><quote lang="la">in quinque residat (cf.: "in the hexameter rises the fountain's silvery column," Coleridge),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47035.11" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to rise to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assume</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attack</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Teucros Aetolis surgit ab Arpis Tydides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: surrecturus in vires, si ipse quoque lacesseretur, Amm. <cb n="SURR" /> 31, 3, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">Procopius in res surrexerat novas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad motum certaminum civilium avide surrecturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad insontium pericula surrexerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 21, 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 198, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surio: <entryFree id="n47036" type="main" key="surio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surio</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be in heat</hi> (cf. subare), Fest. s. v. suillum, p. 310 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag p. 298, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surium: <entryFree id="n47037" type="main" key="Surium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Surium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n47037.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Colchis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47037.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 30, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surius: <entryFree id="n47038" type="main" key="Suri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Surĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Colchis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surpiculus: <entryFree id="n47039" type="main" key="surpi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surpĭcŭlus</orth>, v. scirpiculus.</entryFree>
surradio: <entryFree id="n47040" type="hapax" key="surra^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rădĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n47040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to beam forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to indicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resurrectionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrado: <entryFree id="n47041" type="main" key="surra_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rādo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n47041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scrape below.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47041.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ficos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n47041.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a river, <hi rend="ital">to run close under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flow along</hi> or <hi rend="ital">past</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbaros fines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrancidus: <entryFree id="n47042" type="main" key="surranci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rancĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat rank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly tainted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrasus: <entryFree id="n47043" type="main" key="surra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of surrado.</entryFree>
surrancus: <entryFree id="n47044" type="main" key="surrancus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rancus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat hoarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoarsish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 141</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">subraucum strepens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrectio: <entryFree id="n47045" type="main" key="surrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>surrigo, surgo</etym>. <sense id="n47045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A raising up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phallorum fascinorumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 184</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47045.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rising again</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resurrection</hi>: Christi, Arat 1, 314.</sense></entryFree>
surrectito: <entryFree id="n47046" type="hapax" key="surrecti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrectĭto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n47046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [surgo], <hi rend="ital">to rise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arise</hi>: e convivio, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surrectus: <entryFree id="n47047" type="main" key="surrectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of surgo, I.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47048" type="main" key="surrectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather straight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly straight</hi>: locus, Auct. Rei Agr. p. 240; 252; 260 Goes. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: surrectior vallis, Auct. Rei Agr. p. 240; 252; 260 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
surrefectus: <entryFree id="n47049" type="hapax" key="surre^fectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rĕfectus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n47049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat restored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surregulus: <entryFree id="n47050" type="main" key="surre_gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rēgŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a petty prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a feudatory vassal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 12, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev Hist. Sacr. 2, 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surremaneo: <entryFree id="n47051" type="main" key="surre^ma^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rĕmănĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remain behind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; Jul. Rom. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 172</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
surremigo: <entryFree id="n47052" type="main" key="surre_mi^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rēmĭgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to row underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to row along</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n47052.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva tacitis surremigat undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchiis surremigans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 47, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47052.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">surremigante seu potius velificante nequitiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Fl. Decl. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrenalis: <entryFree id="n47053" type="main" key="surre_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rēnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is under the kidneys</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surrentum: <entryFree id="n47054" type="main" key="Surrentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Surrentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sorrento</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:544" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 544</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 62</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Surren-tīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Surrentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Surrentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina (of excellent quality),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:35" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 20, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 21, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 710</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Surrentina bibis,</quote> <trans><tr>Surrentine wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:110:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 110, 1</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Surrentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Surrentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surrepente: <entryFree id="n47055" type="main" key="surre_pente"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rēpente</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n47055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather suddenly</hi>, Hier. in Ep. ad Galat. prol.</sense></entryFree>
surrepo: <entryFree id="n47056" type="main" key="surre_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rēpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum, 3</itype> (sync. form of <sense id="n47056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> surrepsti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 77, 3</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to creep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">steal along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creep softly on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steal upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come on unawares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insensibly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>, etc. (not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n47056.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sub tabulas, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clathris facile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbis moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrepens lacerta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 70</bibl></cit>: in aulam, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 177</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis surrepit vinea muris,</quote> <trans><tr>advances slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrepit crinibus umor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars mea cogit, Insita praecoquibus surrepere persica prunis,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47056.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 77, 3</bibl></cit>: vide, quam non subrepam tibi. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanda quies furtim surrepit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrepsit fratribus horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:476" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 476</bibl></cit>: surrepet iners aetasTib.<pb n="1818" /> <cb n="SURR" />  1, 1, 71: <cit><quote lang="la">insinuatio surrepat animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulata actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oblivio cibi huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatimque et Romae subrepsit appellatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 2, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:136" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullosque Catonis in actus surrepsit voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 391</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita surrepetur animo judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subreptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, only adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">scandentes in subreptum felium modo,</quote> <trans><tr>stealthily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrepticius: <entryFree id="n47057" type="main" key="surrepti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surreptīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>surripio</etym>, <sense id="n47057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stolen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surreptitious</hi> (Plautin.). </sense><sense id="n47057.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae ingenuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n47057.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clandestine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surreptio: <entryFree id="n47058" type="main" key="surrepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surreptĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purloining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">surreptionem factitasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245, 32</bibl></cit>: per surreptionem elicere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by deception</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subreption</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surreptitius: <entryFree id="n47059" type="main" key="surrepti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surreptītĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, v. surrepticius.</entryFree>
surreptivus: <entryFree id="n47060" type="main" key="surrepti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surreptīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>surripio</etym>, <sense id="n47060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fraudulent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensio, Cod. Th. 12, 16, 1: impetratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 20, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 28, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surreptum: <entryFree id="n47061" type="main" key="surreptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surreptum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. surrepo <sense id="n47061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
surreptus: <entryFree id="n47062" type="main" key="surreptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surreptus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n47062.0" n="1" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood> of surrepo.—</sense><sense id="n47062.1" n="2" level="3"> <mood>Part.</mood> of surripio.</sense></entryFree>
surrideo: <entryFree id="n47063" type="main" key="surri_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rīdĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>si, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to smile</hi> (rare but class.): surridet Saturius veterator, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limis surrisit ocellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surridens Mezentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:82:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 82, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:110" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surridicule: <entryFree id="n47064" type="hapax" key="surri_di^cu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rīdĭcŭlē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ridiculus</etym>, <sense id="n47064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat laughably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather humorously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 249</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surrigo: <entryFree id="n47065" type="main" key="surri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">surrĭgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. surgo.</entryFree>
surriguus: <entryFree id="n47066" type="hapax" key="surri^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rĭgŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">watered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surringor: <entryFree id="n47067" type="hapax" key="surringor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-ringor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>gi</itype>, <sense id="n47067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make a somewhat wry face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be a little vexed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surripio: <entryFree id="n47068" type="main" key="surri^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rĭpĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>rĭpŭi</itype> (rŭpŭi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 38</bibl>; <sense id="n47068.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">v. Ritschl, Proleg. p. xcv.), reptum, 3 (sync. forms: surpite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surpuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 102</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 4, 14: surpuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surpuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 20</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> surrepsit for surripuerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 62</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>rapio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to snatch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take away secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to withdraw privily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to steal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pilfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purloin</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47068.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vasa ex privato sacro surripuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:18:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ejus custodiā filium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 25, 66</bibl></cit>: libros servus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum (servos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">surreptus (puer),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 98</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius ex patriā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacram coronam Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mille fabae modiis unum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappam praetori surpuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:29:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 29, 10</bibl></cit>.—Of literary theft: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a Naevio vel sumpsisti multa, si fateris, vel, si negas, surripuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ennium hoc ait Homero surripuisse, Ennio Vergilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non surripiendi causā, sed palam imitandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrupuisti te mihi dudum de foro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you have stolen away from me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (puella) se surpuerat mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum me surpite morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 283</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare, Si quidvis satis est, perjuras, surripis, aufers Undique?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 127</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47068.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus, quae nec eripi nec surripi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut occulte surripi aut impune eripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surripiendum aliquid putavi spatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus quoque surpere debent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina oculis patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:2:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus quod adhuc subripiebatur, collige et serva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrogo: <entryFree id="n47069" type="main" key="surro^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŏgo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n47069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> publicists' t. t. </sense><sense id="n47069.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the presider in the comitia, <hi rend="ital">to cause to be chosen in place of another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put in another</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> (class.): cum eidem essent (decemviri) nec alios surrogare voluissent. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 36, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam in locum Bruti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorem in locum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SURS" /> consules, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus non surrogatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad magistratus subrogandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47069.2" n="II" level="1"> Lex subrogatur, id est adicitur aliquid primae legi, Ulp. Reg. tit. 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
surrostrani: <entryFree id="n47070" type="hapax" key="surrostra_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rostrāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>rostrum</etym>, <sense id="n47070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">people who hang about the forum near the rostra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loungers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idlers</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
surrotatus: <entryFree id="n47071" type="hapax" key="surro^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŏtātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [roto], <sense id="n47071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mounted on wheels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
surrotundus: <entryFree id="n47072" type="hapax" key="surro^tundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŏtundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roundish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrubeo: <entryFree id="n47073" type="main" key="surru^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭbĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n47073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be somewhat red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to blush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale coloratum Tithoni conjuge caelum Subrubet, aut sponso visa puella novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva purpureo mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 316</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grossi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surruber: <entryFree id="n47074" type="hapax" key="surru^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭber</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>bra, brum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrubeus: <entryFree id="n47075" type="hapax" key="surru^be^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭbĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color ostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 549, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrubicundus: <entryFree id="n47076" type="main" key="surru^bi^cundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rŭbĭcundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat red</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ruddy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reddish</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauliculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrufus: <entryFree id="n47077" type="main" key="surru_fus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rūfus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat reddish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 61, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surrufus aliquantum,</quote> <trans><tr>red - haired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
surrumo: <entryFree id="n47078" type="main" key="surru_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sur-rūmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subr-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>rumis</etym>, <sense id="n47078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put to the udder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let suck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus ovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. Fest. pp. 306 and 307.</sense></entryFree>
