Alex. 19, 4: manibus clipeos et hastam Et galeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix populum tellus sustinet illa suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 182: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis albus Pocula cum cyatho duo sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas ad sustinenda opsonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër volatus alitum sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: lacus omnia illata pondera sustinens, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> on its surface, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce populus Romanus universus veluti duobus navigiis inpositus binis cardinibus sustinetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum pluribus adminiculis fulcit ac sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to support one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stand</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se a lapsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 411</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47146.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to keep in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, etc. (syn.: refreno, supprimo, moror): currum equosque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit> (v. infra, II. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:302" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinet a jugulo dextram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a jugulo nitentem sustinet hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:648" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina Threiciā lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit> (4, 1, 42): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc agendo, nunc sustinendo agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud simile miraculum eos sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:398" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritum exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 18, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:100" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ab omni assensu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to refrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a respondendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 104</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeres vias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to halt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 794" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 794</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47146.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem et decus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tris personas unus sustineo,</quote> <trans><tr>characters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personam magistri,</quote> <trans><tr>to personate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid muneris in rem publicam fungi ac sustinere velitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:86:section=199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 86, § 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam veterem atque antiquam haec mea senectus sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: vitam, Maecen. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 11</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbor) ingentem sustinet umbram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 297</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47146.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sustain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, by food, money, or other means: <cit><quote lang="la">hac (sc. re frumentariā) alimur et sustinemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:5:section=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 5, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veterem amicum suum labentem excepit, fulsit et sustinuit re, fortunā, fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ager non amplius hominum quinque milia potest sustinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus munificentiā sustineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc patriam parvosque nepotes Sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessitates aliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 65, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penuriam temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure; to hold out against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withstand</hi> (so most freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: fero, tolero, patior): mala ferre sustinereque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tu scis, quantum malarum rerum sustineam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocens suspitionem hanc sustinet causā meā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:39:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 36, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o dii, quis hujus potentiam poterit sustinere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philo ea sustinere vix poterat, quae contra Academicorum pertinaciam dicebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Peloponnesum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: eos (rogantes), Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus querentes eos non sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa petentem deam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 788</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum ignemque Jovemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:385" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 385</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: expectes<cb n="SUSU" />  et sustineas necesse est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:3:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque jam sustineri poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi> (mostly with a negative: non sustinet, <hi rend="ital">he cannot bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cannot endure; he does not take upon himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">does not venture</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">non sustineo esse conscius mihi dissimulati judicii mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non impositos supremis ignibus artus Sustinuit spectare parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 584</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so negatively,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:530" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 530</bibl></cit>; 6, 367; 6, 606; 9, 439; 10, 47; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:850" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 850</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86, 2</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">In a negative interrog.: sustinebant tales viri, se tot senatoribus, etc. ... non credidisse? tantae populi Romani voluntati restitisse? Sustineant. Reperiemus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem quis hominum sustineat petulans esse ad alterius arbitrium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:64" default="NO">3, 6, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere officii sui partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 13, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parmenionem rursus castigare non sustinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:15" default="NO">6, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solus bibere sustineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:15" default="NO">7, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:7" default="NO">8, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 75</bibl>.—Affirmatively: <cit><quote lang="la">quem in vinculis habituri erant, sustinuere venerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloqui cum eo, quem damnaverat, sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:38" default="NO">7, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:25" default="NO">10, 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae se praeferre Dianae Sustinuit,</quote> <trans><tr>took upon herself</tr>, <tr>presumed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 322</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sustinet ire illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:447" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 447</bibl></cit>; 6, 563; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 16, 8</bibl>: aliquem videre, Auct. Cons. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aquam ... haurire sustineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentiri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47146.10" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B.) <hi rend="ital">To hold in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain; to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est igitur prudentis sustinere ut currum sic impetum benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">impetum hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2 et saep.: subitas hostium incursiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:11" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio praemittit equites, qui primum impetum sustineant ac morentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensus lubricos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinenda solutio est nominis Caerelliani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 51, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationem ad noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sustollo: <entryFree id="n47147" type="main" key="sustollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustollo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v.a.</hi> [subs for sub (v. sub, III.), and tollo], <hi rend="ital">to lift</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to raise up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi> (ante- and post-class.; cf.: erigo, effero). </sense><sense id="n47147.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecae sunt hae columnae, sustolli solent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be set upon a high pedestal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torvos ad aethera vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(navem) levi sustollit machina nisu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 906</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:235" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">papulas alte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 38, 716</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47147.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. * </sense><sense id="n47147.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To build</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>: novum opus in quālibet civitate, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 28. — </sense><sense id="n47147.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erilem filiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has aedes totas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustolli ab his locis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sustuli: <entryFree id="n47148" type="main" key="sustu^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sustŭli</orth>, v. suffero and tollo.</entryFree>
susum: <entryFree id="n47149" type="main" key="susum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">susum</orth>, v. sursum.</entryFree>
susurramen: <entryFree id="n47150" type="main" key="su^surra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. susurro</etym>, <sense id="n47150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a muttering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 103, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 726</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susurratim: <entryFree id="n47151" type="main" key="su^surra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a low voice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">decenter arrisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 705</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
susurratio: <entryFree id="n47152" type="main" key="su^surra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whispering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Laps. Virg. Cons. 6, 25</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 12, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susurrator: <entryFree id="n47153" type="main" key="su^surra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mutterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whisperer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tale-bearer</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus, 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susurratrix: <entryFree id="n47154" type="main" key="su^surra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>susurrator</etym>, <sense id="n47154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a whisperer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysolog. Serm. 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susurro: <entryFree id="n47155" type="main" key="su^surro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n47155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. susurrus; root sur], <hi rend="ital">to make a low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continued sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buzz</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmur; to mutter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whisper</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose). </sense><sense id="n47155.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">susurrant (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aura susurrantis venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut ego cum carā de te nutrice susurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama susurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:21:233" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha susurrans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">susurravit obscurior fama,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: leve Mincius susurret, Claud.Nupt.Hon. et Mar. Fesc. 2, 11.—</sense><sense id="n47155.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantica qui Nili, qui Gaditana susurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:63:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 63, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versum Persii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te (silvestris platanus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: susurrans quaedam,<pb n="1823" /> <cb n="SUTR" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars, quid velit, aure susurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 643</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam susurrari audio, Civem Atticam esse hanc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47156" type="main" key="su^surro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. susurro</etym>, <sense id="n47156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mutterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whisperer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tale-bearer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aures mariti susurronum faece completae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 11, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
susurrus: <entryFree id="n47157" type="main" key="su^surrus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (collat. form of the <sense id="n47157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> susurru, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 357, 39</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>redupl. from root sur, sar, to speak, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=322" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 322</bibl> Müll.; cf. absurdus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gentle noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a humming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">murmuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a muttering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whispering</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquam ferentis mulierculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam age: nolo murmur ullum, neque susurrum fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(saepes) levi somnum suadebit inire susurro (apum), Verg E. 1, 56: tacito mala vota susurro Concipiunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a low</tr>, <tr>muttered prayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rauco susurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui jugulos aperire susurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:110" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 110</bibl></cit>. — In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandos audire susurros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:62" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> — <cit><quote lang="la">Personified: Susurri,</quote> <trans><tr>Whispers</tr>, <tr>the attendants of Fame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47158" type="hapax" key="su^surrus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭsurrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. susurrus</etym>, <sense id="n47158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">muttering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whispering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 825</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suta: <entryFree id="n47159" type="main" key="su_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. suo <sense id="n47159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sutela: <entryFree id="n47160" type="main" key="su_te_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suo</etym>, prop. a sewing together; hence, trop., <sense id="n47160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cunning device</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contrivance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wile</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">sutelae dolosae astutiae a similitudine suentium dictae, Fest. pp. 310 and 311 Müll.: ob sutelas tuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suthul: <entryFree id="n47161" type="main" key="Suthul"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suthul</orth>, <itype>ŭlis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 37, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sutilis: <entryFree id="n47162" type="main" key="su_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>suo</etym>, <sense id="n47162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sewed together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fastened together</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). balteus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 40, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>made of skins sewed together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:81" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>sewed on the philyrae</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:335" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 335</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:91:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 91, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 8, § 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:91:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 91, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:94:5" default="NO">9, 94, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapilli,</quote> <trans><tr>set in a wreath</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyacinthi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ham. 269</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sutor: <entryFree id="n47163" type="main" key="su_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cobbler.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47163.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5, 39</bibl>; Asell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 93</bibl> Müll.: crepidarius, Asell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21, 8</bibl>: SVTORVM COLLEGIVM, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 1, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:75" default="NO">9, 75</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi> al.—To denote people of the lower class: <cit><quote lang="la">id sutores et zonarii conclamarunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:294" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 294</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: sutor, ne supra crepidam (judicaret),</quote> <trans><tr>let the cobbler stick to his last</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12</bibl>, ext. 3. — * </sense><sense id="n47163.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cobbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patcher up</hi> of things: <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sutoricius: <entryFree id="n47164" type="main" key="su_to_ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtōrīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sutor</etym>, <sense id="n47164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a shoemaker</hi> (for the class. sutorius): atramentum, <hi rend="ital">shoemakers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">blacking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sutorius: <entryFree id="n47165" type="main" key="su_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a shoemaker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cobbler</hi> (class.): atramentum, <hi rend="ital">shoemakers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">blacking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:123" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 12, 32, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 8</bibl>: fistula, <hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s punch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 23, § 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">MERX,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turpio sutorius,</quote> <trans><tr>formerly a shoemaker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: Atrium Sutorium, <hi rend="ital">Shoemakers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">Hall</hi>, a place in Rome, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 14</bibl> Müll.; Calend. Praenest. m. Mart. (ap. Inscr. Orell. II., p. 386); v. atrium <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sutriballus: <entryFree id="n47166" type="main" key="su_tri_ballus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrīballus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cobbler</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sutrina: <entryFree id="n47167" type="main" key="su_tri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. sutrinus, II.</entryFree>
sutrinus: <entryFree id="n47168" type="main" key="su_tri_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>contr. for sutorinus, from sutor</etym>, <sense id="n47168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a shoemaker</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cobbler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoemaker</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi>- (mostly post-Aug. for sutorius). </sense><sense id="n47168.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 93</bibl> Müll. — </sense><sense id="n47168.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47168.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n47168.4" n="1" level="3"> (Sc. officina.) <hi rend="ital">A shoemaker</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s shop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cobbler</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s stall;</hi> sutrinae manceps, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 43, 60, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:112" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 37, § 112</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 5</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47168.5" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. ars.) <hi rend="ital">The shoemaker</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s trade</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6</bibl>, praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 18, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 346, 35</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n47168.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. artificium),<cb n="SUUS" />  <hi rend="ital">a shoemaker</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s work</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47169" type="main" key="Su_tri_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūtrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Sutrium, I.</entryFree>
sutrium: <entryFree id="n47170" type="main" key="Su_tri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūtrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient town in Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sutri</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>. — Prov.: quasi eant Sutrium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to set about any thing well prepared</hi> (as Camillus, when he marched to the conquest of Sutrium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 1, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=310" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 310</bibl> Müll. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47170.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūtrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sutrium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 51</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūtrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sutrium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47170.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūtrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sutrium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:493" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 493</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sutrix: <entryFree id="n47171" type="gloss" key="su_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sutor</etym>, <sense id="n47171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sewingwoman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> p. 199, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">220, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sutura: <entryFree id="n47172" type="main" key="su_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suo</etym>, <sense id="n47172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sewing together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a seam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutale crebris suturis duratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calvariae,</quote> <trans><tr>a suture of the skull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit> and 4.</sense></entryFree>
sutus: <entryFree id="n47173" type="main" key="su_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suo.</entryFree>
suus: <entryFree id="n47174" type="main" key="su^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (old form sos, sa, sum; <sense id="n47174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> sis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl> Müll.; <case>acc.</case> sas. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 325 ib.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47</bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:108" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 108</bibl>; <number>sing.</number> sam for suam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">so for suo, C. I. L. 5, 2007. In ante-class. verse su- with the following vowel freq. forms one syllable,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1022" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1022</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 189 sqq.), <hi rend="ital">pron. poss.</hi>, 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi> [root SVA-; Sanscr. svá, own; cf. sui; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sevo-,</foreign> whence <foreign lang="greek">sfe,</foreign> etc., and <foreign lang="greek">e(;</foreign> cf. <foreign lang="greek">e(o/s</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herself</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">his own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her own</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">its</hi>, <hi rend="ital">their; one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s; hers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">theirs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.1" n="I" level="1"> Ordinary possessive use <hi rend="ital">his</hi>, etc. (cf. the similar use of the <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi> sui, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n47174.2" n="A" level="2"> With antecedent in the same sentence. </sense><sense id="n47174.3" n="1" level="3"> The antecedent a <hi rend="ital">subject-nominative</hi>, expressed or understood. </sense><sense id="n47174.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">His</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar copias suas divisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille in suā sententiā perseverat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam habebat suarum rerum fiduciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sceleris sui socios Romae reliquisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ego non ignoscam si anteposuit suam salutem meae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 32, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 18, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hanno praefecturam ejus (i.e. Muttinis) filio suo (Hannonis) dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperat princeps civibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo rem suam emit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Her</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea Glycerium suos parentes repperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam haec ignoraret suum patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nunc facere volt era officium suom,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne eadem mulier cum suo conjuge honestissimum adulescentem oppressisse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si omnibus suis copiis excellentem virum res publica armasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 16, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.6" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Its</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal, simul et ortum est, et se ipsum et omnes partes suas diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mea domus ardore suo deflagrationem Italiae toti minaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.7" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Their</hi>: (legiones) si consulem suum reliquerunt, vituperandae sunt <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittent aliquem de suo numero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem illi sententiae suae non fere reddebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui agellos suos redimere a piratis solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:37:section=85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 37, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edicunt ut ad suum vestitum senatores redirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis finibus eos prohibent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: Allobrogibus sese persuasuros existimabant ut per suos (Allobrogum) fines eos (Helvetios) ire paterentur, id. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and distributively: ac naves onerariae LXIII. in portu expugnatae, quaedam cum suis oneribus, frumento, armis, aere, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>some with their several cargoes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:47:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 47, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.8" n="2" level="3"> With a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi> as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">id suā sponte apparebat tuta celeribus consiliis praepositurum,</quote> <trans><tr>was selfevident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 38, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id quod suā sponte satis collectum animorum erat, indignitate etiam Romani accendebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secutum tamen suā sponte est ut vilior ob ea regi Hannibal et suspectior fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 14, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47174.9" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subject-acc.</hi> as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc dicam Athenis advenisse cum aliquo amatore suo, Plant. Mil. 2, 2, 86: doceo gratissimum esse in suā tribu Plancium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio eum suae causae confidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicari debuit (Milo), eum (Clodium) ad villam suam (Clodii) deversurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 19, 51</bibl></cit>: Medeam <cb n="SUUS" /> praedicant in fugā fratris sui membra dissipavisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dixit) Caesarem pro suā dignitate debere et studium et iracundiam suam reipublicae dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.10" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">object-acc.</hi> as antecedent. </sense><sense id="n47174.11" n="(a)" level="5"> Suus being an adjunct of the subject (generally rendered in Engl. by a pass. constr.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc pater suus de templo deduxit,</quote> <trans><tr>he was taken from the temple by his father</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:17:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 17, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sui cives e civitate ejecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:68:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 68, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum uxor sua ... occidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ulciscentur mores sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi quem natura sua ... forte deficiet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque regem sua multitudo consalutaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (urbes) sua virtus ac dii juvent, magnas sibi opes facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 33, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos nec sua conscientia impulerit, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 14, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem C. Marium servus suus interemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non Vedium Pollionem pejus oderat quam servi sui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sera dies sit quā illum gens sua caelo adserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Poll. 12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Poll. 12</bibl></cit> (31), 5.—With the antecedent understood from the principal sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">ita forma simili pueri ut mater sua internoscere (sc. eos) non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 19</bibl></cit>; and with suus as adjunct both of the subject and of the antecedent: jubet salvere suos vir uxorem suam, id. merc. 4, 3, 11. — </sense><sense id="n47174.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">impers. verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt homines, quos libidinis infamiaeque suae neque pudeat neque taedeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video fore ut inimicos tuos poeniteat intemperantiae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Caesarem beneficii sui poeniteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ne nobilitatis quidem suae plebejos poenitere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem jam minus virtutis poenitere suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.13" n="(g)" level="5"> As adjunct of other members of the sentence: <cit><quote lang="la">ad parentes suos ducas Silenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 86</bibl></cit>. nam is illius filiam conicit in navem clam matrem suam (i.e. filiae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eosdem ad quaestoris sui aut imperatoris, aut commilitonum suorum pericula impulistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 17, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum enim ex suā patriā sustulisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 127</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:32:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 3, 32, 126</bibl>: quem (Hammonium) tibi etiam suo nomine (<hi rend="ital">on his own account</hi>) commendo ... itaque peto a te ut ejus procuratorem et ipsum suo nomine diligas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Fabium in sua remittit hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">introire ad Ciceronem, et domi suae imparatum confodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis flammis delete Fidenas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the flames kindled by the Fidenates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo igni involvit hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Caesarem in sua fata inmisit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:65" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1</bibl>, praef. 7; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with antecedent supplied from preceding sentence: non destiti rogare et petere (sc. Brutum) meā causā, suadere et hortari suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.14" n="5" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> as antecedent. </sense><sense id="n47174.15" n="(a)" level="5"> As adjunct of subject (cf. 4. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">suus rex reginae placet,</quote> <trans><tr>a queen likes her own king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei nunc alia ducenda'st domum, sua cognata Lemniensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Autronio nonne sodales, non collegae sui ... defuerunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ceteris facta sua recte prosunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non magistri sui atque doctores, cui non ... locus ipse ... in mente versetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia plane ... Siculis erepta sunt: primum suae leges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:13:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 13, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanis multitudo sua auxit animum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicuti populo Romano sua fortuna labet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 50, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lanuvinis sacra sua reddita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilitas sua illis detrahit pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est cui felicitas sua satisfaciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 115:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 115, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor illi suus restitutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 20:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo sua singulis constat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum sapienti sua, quantum Dec omnis aetas patet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 53, 11</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">With antecedent supplied from principal sentence: mater quod suasit sua Adulescens mulier fecit, i.e. ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.16" n="(b)" level="5"> Of other words: <cit><quote lang="la">regique Thebano regnum stabilivit suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittam hodie huic suo die natali malam rem magnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Metello non irascor, neque ei suam vacationem eripio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:68:section=164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 68, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinant insidiari domui suae consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ea res honori fuerit a suis civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 96</bibl></cit>: Scipio suas res Syracusanis restituit, Liv. <pb n="1824" /> <cb n="SUUS" /> 29, 1, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">nos non suas (leges Lacedaemoniis arbitror) ademisse, sed nostras leges dedisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 39, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graccho et Tuditano provinciae Lucani et Galliae cum suis exercitibus prorogatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.17" n="6" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>abl.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">object of a prep.</hi> as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">nec illius animi aciem praestringit splendor sui nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite a sacris patriis Junonis Sospitae domesticum et suum consulem avellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 41, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis tu magna mihi scripseris de Bruti adventu ad suas legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae legis ad scriptum ipsam quoque sententiam adjungere,</quote> <trans><tr>the meaning of their law to which they refer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ambitio alterius suam primum apud eos majestatem solvisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 42, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc causam instituendorum ludorum ab origine suā repetam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jubam in regno suo non locorum notitia adjuvet, non popularium pro rege suo virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 7, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 4</bibl>.—Esp. with cujusque as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua deliberatione ad suam cujusque naturam consilium est omne revocandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 119</bibl></cit> (v. II. D. 2. infra).—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">operam dare ut sua lex ipso scripto videatur niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:147" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 147</bibl></cit> (cf. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar reperiebat) ad Galbam propter justitiam prudentiamque suam totius belli summam deferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere, ad suum concilium a Jove deos advocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:42:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 42, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.18" n="7" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">predic. nom.</hi> as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientissimi artis suae professores sunt a quibus et propria studia verecunde et aliena callide administrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47174.19" n="8" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">appositive noun.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47174.20" n="(a)" level="5"> With gram. subject as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc Anaximandro, populari ac sodali suo, non persuasit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit fortissimum virum, inimicissimum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hic) fuit in Cretā contubernalis Saturnini, propinqui sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non per L. Crassum, adfinem suum ... causam illam defenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne cum hoc T. Broccho, avunculo, ne cum ejus filio, consobrino suo, ne nobiscum vivat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar mittit ad eum A. Clodium, suum atque illius familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 57</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47174.21" n="(b)" level="5"> With object as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">Dicaearchum cum Aristoxeno, aequali et condiscipulo suo, omittamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres fratres optimos, non solum sibi ipsos, neque nobis, necessariis suis, sed etiam rei publicae condonavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varroni, quem, sui generis hominem, ... vulgus extrahere ad consulatum nitebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 34, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.22" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">appositive noun</hi> as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">si P. Scipionem, clarissimum virum, majorumque suorum simillimum res publica tenere potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Fabi Ambusti, potentis viri cum inter sui corporis homines, tum ad plebem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. vero Fabricii, et Q. Aemilii Papi, principum saeculi sui, domibus argentum fuisse confitear oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.23" n="9" level="3"> In participial clauses. </sense><sense id="n47174.24" n="(a)" level="5"> The antecedent being the logical subject of the participle, and other than the principal subject: <cit><quote lang="la">credamus igitur Panaetio, a Platone suo dissentienti ( = qui dissentiebat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea Sex. Roscium, expulsum ex suis bonis, recepit domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidentemque rebus suis confirmavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dejotarum ad me venientem cum omnibus copiis suis, certiorem feci, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl>: si hominis et suis et populi Romani ornamentis amplissimi (<hi rend="ital">being greatly distinguished</hi>) causam repudiassem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupentes tribunos et suam jam vicem magis anxios quam, etc., liberavit consensus populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 35, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 42, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manet in folio scripta querela suo ( = quam scripsit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:224" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 224</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsis (hostibus) regressis in castra sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (speculis) si unum ostenderis hominem, populus adparet, unāquāque parte faciem exprimente sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.25" n="(b)" level="5"> The logical subject of the participle, being also the principal subject: <cit><quote lang="la">sic a suis legionibus condemnatus irrupit in Galliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc agrum patres nostri, acceptum a majoribus suis ( = quem acceperant), perdiderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in suis ordinibus dispositi dispersos adorirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92</bibl></cit>: Appius, odium in se aliorum suo in eos metiens odio, haud ignaro, inquit, imminet fortuna,<cb n="SUUS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa capit Condita in pharetrā ( = quae condiderat) tela minora suā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:326" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 326</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sopater, expositis suis difficultatibus ( = cum exposuisset, etc.): Timarchidem ... perducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar, primum suo deinde omnium ex conspectu remotis equis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campani, auditā suā pariter sociorumque clade, legatos ad Hannibalem miserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Appius) deposito suo magistratu ... domum est reductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 35, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10, 13</bibl>; 9, 41, 9.—</sense><sense id="n47174.26" n="(g)" level="5"> The antecedent being the principal subject, not the logical subject of the participle: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Papirius dicitur Gallo, barbam suam (i.e. Papirii) permulcenti, ... iram movisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 9</bibl></cit>: cum Gracchus, verecundiā deserendi socios, implorantis fidem suam populique Romani, substitisset. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 36, 8</bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si sine maximo dedecore, tam impeditis suis rebus, potuisset emori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita (consul) proelio uno accidit Vestinorum res, haudquāquam tamen incruento milite suo (consulis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with antecedent to be supplied: Campani, cum, robore juventutis suae acciso, nulla (sc. eis) propinqua spes esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 29, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47174.27" n="10" level="3"> In gerund. construction. ( <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> ) With subject as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi ipsa Roma ad complectendum conservatorem suum progredi visa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47174.28" n="(b)" level="5"> With object, the logical subjects of the <hi rend="ital">gerund</hi> as antecedent: <cit><quote lang="la">cur iis persequendi juris sui ... adimis potestatem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si senatui doloris sui de me declarandi potestas esset erepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:23:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 23, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tribunis plebis (spatium datur) sui periculi deprecandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
